p: Several studies have suggested that gender can modulate PD risk, with women showing lower incidence and prevalence of the disease [ 47]. Some studies suggest that estrogen and its signalling pathways account for some of these differences [ 48, 49]. The protective effects of estrogen appear to be related to inhibiting the function of the dopamine transporter [ 50, 51], preventing loss of VMAT2 [ 52], and other pathways [ 53]. Thus we could speculate that estrogen exerts neuroprotective effects on nigrostriatal neurons and that this estrogen effect is much stronger than the neuroprotective effect of VMAT2. As a result, the neuroprotective effects of VMAT2 may be more obvious in men, who have a relatively low concentration of estrogen. This model is consistent with our finding that the A allele of rs363371 appears to protect Han Chinese men from developing PD.
